intro: Tricalysia somaliensis, commonly known as the Somali trumpet tree, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has elongated, narrow leaves and produces small, winged fruits that disperse its seeds. It thrives in dry, arid environments and is often found in rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
